head.title: PCRAFI II SURVEY FORM - Data Collection

select.label: COUNTRY
select.hint: Select the country the survey is being held in

input.label: Collect GPS point
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device). Stand not too close to the building. Your view of the Sky above must be clear.

upload.label: Photo of Building 1
upload.hint: Take a picture from the corner of the building so that both sides of the Walls and Roof (including guttering if any) are covered

upload.label: Photo of Building 2
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo of Building 3
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo of Building 4
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Usage/Occupancy Class
select.hint: Refers to the purpose for which the building is currently being used for.

select.label: Subuse
select.hint: Some buildings can have dual use. Eg: Some buildings can have a supermarket and a coffee shop within the same building

select.label: Foundation Type
select.hint: The foundation, usually below the ground, is the part of the building that transfers and distributes the weight of the building onto the ground.

select.label: Foundation Bracing
select.hint: An inclined piece of material applied to the foundation to strengthen the structure.

select.label: Foundation Condition
select.hint: Refers to the condition of the foundation.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: There is no corrosion or holes or wear and tear. There is no cracked or damage on the foundation structure. The foundation material has no peeling and no presence of green algae or moss (especially if the foundation is made of wood and is right above ground).
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the foundation structure has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.

(3) Fair condition: The condition of the foundation at this stage can still be maintained through regular maintenance such as painting, algae can be removed. Repair can be done to the foundation materials.

(2) Poor condition: Foundation has moderate damage. There is sign of moderate impairment. However, this condition can be repaired or restored through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment of damaged.
(1) Very poor condition: Foundation structure has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment in condition. It is not possible to restore the foundation.

select.label: Min Floor Height above ground
select.hint: Minimum distance from ground level to the floor of the first living level. Recorded in meters.

select.label: Max Floor Height above ground
select.hint: Maximum distance from ground level to the floor of the first living level. Recorded in meters.

select.label: Building Structure
select.hint: The building structure above the foundation

select.label: Wall Material
select.hint: Refers to main material used to construct walls of the buildings occupied levels.

select.label: Wall Condition
select.hint: Refers to the condition of the wall.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: There is no corrosion or holes or wear and tear. There is no cracked, damaged, or missing tile. There are no dark stains on the wall, no peeling, no crack and no presence of green algae or moss building moss or leaf or plant material (especially if there are trees around the house). No blistering or buckling effect seen on the wall surface.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the roof has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.

(3) Fair condition: Wall has minor to moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. The condition of the wall at this stage can still be maintained through regular maintenance such as clean gutters, remove plant material, prune tree branches around the wall, etc.

(2) Poor condition: Wall has moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. However, this condition can be repaired or restored through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment of damaged, degraded, deteriorated part of the wall. Wall is recoverable.

(1) Very Poor condition: Wall has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment in condition. It is not possible to restore the wall through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment. Wall needs to be replaced with new wall.

select.label: Window Type
select.hint: Refers to diverse types of opening on the walls of the building.

select.label: Window Protection
select.hint: Whether windows have protection which can include shutters or brackets/hinges for shutters on them for protection against wind damage, exterior burglar bars, partial protection or none at all.

select.label: Roof Shape
select.hint: The shape of the roof

select.label: Roof Material
select.hint: Material utilised to construct the roof

select.label: Roof Pitch
select.hint: The steepness at which the roof is sloped.

select.label: Roof Condition
select.hint: Refers to the condition of the roof.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: There is no corrosion or holes or wear and tear. There is no cracked, damaged, or missing tile. There are no dark stains on the roof, no peeling, no crack and no presence of green algae or moss building moss or leaf or plant material (especially if there are trees around the house). No blistering or buckling effect seen on the roof surface.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the roof has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.

(3) Fair condition: Roof has minor to moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. The condition of the roof at this stage can still be maintained through regular maintenance such as clean gutters, remove plant material, prune tree branches around the roof, etc.

(2) Poor condition: Roof has moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. However, this condition can be repaired or restored through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment of damaged, degraded, deteriorated part of the roof. Roof is recoverable.

(1) Very poor condition: Roof has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment in condition. It is not possible to restore the roof through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment. Roof needs to be replaced with new roof.

select.label: Building Year
select.hint: The length of time the building has been in existence by surveyor's observation upon visual interpretation.

input.label: Number of Storeys
input.hint: The number of occupied storeys/levels.

select.label: Under Storey level
select.hint: Presence of any basement level below ground level.

select.label: Utilities
select.hint: Evidence of utilities connected to the building example water, electricity, telecommunication, solar.

select.label: Vehicle
select.hint: Refers to a thing used for transporting people, or goods on land.

select.label: Telecommunication Access
select.hint: The exchange of information over significant distances by electronic means.

input.label: Employment Status
input.hint: Head of household employment status

select.label: Disability
select.hint: Type of disability of people living in the Dwelling

input.label: Number of people in the Household
input.hint: Number of people livibg in the building

input.label: Number of Males
input.hint: The male count in a population.

input.label: Number of Female
input.hint: The female count in a population.

input.label: Place of Residence
input.hint: Refers to the place whereby a person lives in. This may be a house, an apartment, retirement home, an assisted living facility, and housing for elderly.

input.label: Language
input.hint: National language

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

upload.label: Photo 1 of Water Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 2 of Water Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 3 of Water Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 4 of Water Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Asset type
select.hint: Water asset type

select.label: Source Type
select.hint: Refers to the water source refers to the origin of the water.

select.label: Condition
select.hint: Refers to the overall condition of the asset.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: Water asset has no corrosion, or holes or wear and tear. There are no cracked, damaged or missing pieces. There are no dark stains, no peeling, no cracks and no presence of green algae or moss growing on the material.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the water asset has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.

(3) Fair condition: Approximately, 50-80% of the water asset is in fair condition. Water asset has minor to moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. The condition of the water asset can still be maintained through regular maintenance.

(2) Poor condition: Approximately, 30-50% of the water asset is operable. Water asset has moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. However, this condition can be repaired or restored through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment of damaged, degraded, deteriorated portion. Water asset is recoverable.

(1) Very Poor condition: Water asset has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment in condition. It is not possible to restore the water asset through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment. Water asset needs to be replaced.

select.label: Water Network
select.hint: Refers to the presence of reticulation system within the area.

select.label: Asset Ownership
select.hint: The ownership of the asset.

select.label: Asset Material
select.hint: The material used to construct the water asset.

select.label: Covered
select.hint: Cover on the Asset

select.label: Treated
select.hint: The water is safe for consumption as it is treated by chemical, filtered or boiled to eliminate infectious bacteria, viruses and parasites.

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

upload.label: Photo 1 of Electrical Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 2 of Electrical Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 3 of Electrical Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 4 of Electrical Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Asset Type
select.hint: The type of asset the field surveyor is collecting in the field.

select.label: Source Type
select.hint: The energy source of the electricity.

item.label: Renewable (Hydro, Solar, Wind, Biomass, Geothermal, OTEC)

select.label: Asset Material
select.hint: The material used to construct the asset.

select.label: Transformer type
select.hint: The type of transformer mounting.

select.label: Ownership
select.hint: The ownership of the asset.

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

upload.label: Photo 1 of Fuel Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 2 of Fuel Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 3 of Fuel Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 4 of Fuel Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Fuel Type
select.hint: Refers to the different types of fuel.

select.label: Fuel Asset Type
select.hint: Refers to the fuel asset type.

select.label: Tank Material
select.hint: Refers to the tank materials.

input.label: Storage Capacity
input.hint: Volume in liters

select.label: Storage Type
select.hint: How is the fuel stored.

input.label: Fuel Service Provider
input.hint: Name of the Service Provider

select.label: Tenure
select.hint: Refers to the land status on which the fuel is located.

select.label: Condition
select.hint: Refers to the condition of the asset type.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: The asset is in excellent condition. There is no presence of damage, defects, deformation, deterioration or impairment to the asset storage. The asset is a brand new and is fully used in services.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the fuel storage has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.

(3) Fair condition: Fuel has moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. The fuel can still be maintained through maintenance such as solid reinforcement, and cleaning of fuel.

(2) Poor condition: More than half of the fuel is damaged causing disruption in services. The fuel tank has major cracks, defect, major rust and the asset can barely support itself. It can still be repaired through some economically efficient rehabilitation. The fuel may need to be replaced if it is not maintained.
(1) Very poor condition: The asset has major damaged. The asset storage has completely damaged. There is a major explosion to the asset. The asset cannot be used.

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

upload.label: Photo 1 of Telecommunication Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 2 of Telecommunication Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 3 of Telecommunication Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 4 of Telecommunication Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Asset Condition
select.hint: Refers to the condition of the asset.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: There is no cracked or damage on the structure. The material that makes up the infrastructure has no peeling and no presence of green algae or moss.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the asset has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.
(3) Fair condition: The condition of the asset can still be maintained through regular maintenance. Repair can be done to the asset.

(2) Poor condition: Asset has moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. The asset can be repaired or restored through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment of damaged.
(1) Very condition: Asset has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment. The asset cannot be restored.

select.label: Asset Type
select.hint: Refers to the structure type.

input.label: Subuse
input.hint: Secondary use of the asset

select.label: Tower Height
select.hint: Refers to capturing the height of the asset in meters (refers mainly to towers and poles).

select.label: Tower Construction Material
select.hint: Material used to construct the structure.

select.label: Tower Use
select.hint: This refers to the primary use of the asset.

select.label: Subtype
select.hint: Refers to the secondary use of the asset structure.

select.label: Satellite dishes attached
select.hint: Presence of a satellite dish in the asset.

select.label: Sirens attached
select.hint: Siren attached to the asset structure.

select.label: Antenna attached
select.hint: Presence of the antenna in the asset structure.

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

upload.label: Photo 1 of Bridge Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 2 of Bridge Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 3 of Bridge Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 4 of Bridge Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Bridge Tenure
select.hint: Refers to the land status on which the bridge is located.

select.label: Bridge Type
select.hint: Refers to the structural architect of the bridge.

input.label: Length
input.hint: The distance of the bridge in meters

input.label: Width
input.hint: Width of the Bridge is recorded in meters.

input.label: Min.Height of Deck to water
input.hint: The minimum height taken from the water level to the deck.

input.label: Max.Height of Deck to water
input.hint: The maximum height taken from the water level to the deck.

select.label: Piles
select.hint: Bridge are built on Piles

select.label: Wingwall
select.hint: Refers to a retaining wall on the bridge outer edge.

select.label: Abutment material
select.hint: Material that makes up the retaining wall at the ends of the bridge usually in an arch shape.

select.label: Super-structure Condition
select.hint: Refers to condition of the superstructure.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: There is no cracked or damage on the structure. The asset structure has no damaged and is brand new.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the asset has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.
(3) Fair condition: The condition of the asset at this stage can still be maintained through regular maintenance. Repair can be done to the asset.

(2) Poor condition: Asset has moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. The asset can be repaired or restored through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment of damaged.
(1)Very Poor condition: Asset has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment in condition. It is not possible to restore the asset.

select.label: Superstructure materials
select.hint: Refers to the material used to construct the super-structure.

select.label: Deck Material
select.hint: Refers to the material used to construct the deck.

select.label: Deck Condition
select.hint: Refers to any damage to the deck structure.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: There is no cracked or damage on the asset structure. The material of the asset structure has no defects, no deformation and no deterioration.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the asset has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.
(3) Fair condition: The condition of the asset regular maintenance. Repair can be done to the asset.

(2) Poor condition: Asset has moderate damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. However, this condition can be repaired or restored through some economically efficient rehabilitation/refurbishment of damaged.
(1) Very Poor condition: Asset has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment in condition.

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

upload.label: Photo 1 of Port Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 2 of Port Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 3 of Port Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 4 of Port Asset
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Asset Type
select.hint: Refers to the different types of port structures.

select.label: Port Use
select.hint: Refers to the usage of the port.

select.label: Types of Vessel
select.hint: Types of vessel that birth at this port

input.label: Number of Tug Boats
input.hint: Number of Tug boats at this port

select.label: Condition of port
select.hint: Refers to the condition of the port.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: The port is in excellent condition and is open for different uses. The port is accessible for international, domestic and private usage. There is no presence of damage, defects, no deformation.
(4) Good condition: 80% or more of the port has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment.
(3) Fair condition: Port has minor condition, defects, deformation, deterioration, and impairment.

(2) Poor condition: More than half of the port is in bad condition causing disruption in services. The port has major defects, deformation, deterioration and impairment. Port can be repaired through some economic refurbishment.
(1) Very Poor condition: The port asset such as wharf, jetties, piers and marina are completely destroyed and in non-operatable. The port has major defects, deformation and deterioration.

select.label: Tenure
select.hint: Refers to the land status on which the port is located.

input.label: Length of birth
input.hint: Length in meters

input.label: Width of Apron
input.hint: Width in meters

select.label: Construction material
select.hint: Refers to the material used to construct the port structure.

select.label: Decking
select.hint: Material for decking

input.label: Port Vessel Capacity
input.hint: Number of ships can birth at one time

input.label: Port storage capacity
input.hint: Number of Containers storage

select.label: Seawall Type
select.hint: Refers to the type of seawalls.

input.label: Seawall length
input.hint: Refers to the start and end point of the seawall. Record in meters.

input.label: Replacement Cost
input.hint: The buildings/facilities attached to port be included for costing. Have a sum of the facility cost separate to port replacement cost

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

select.label: Navigation light/system

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device)

upload.label: Photo 1 of Road
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 2 of Road
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 3 of Road
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

upload.label: Photo 4 of Road
upload.hint: Take a picture of the asset.

select.label: Road class
select.hint: Refers to the road class.

select.label: Surface/Seal
select.hint: Surface/seal material

select.label: Condition
select.hint: Refers to the condition of the road.

item.label: (5) Excellent condition: There is no cracked or potholes. There is no damage on the road structure. The paved edges are not damaged. (>80km/h)
(4) Good Condition: 80% or more of the road has no damage, no defects, no deformation, no deterioration, and no impairment. (60-80km/h)

(3) Fair condition: Road has fair condition, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or impairment. The road can still be maintained through maintenance such as rack sealing, pothole repair, and the repair of paved edges. (40-60km/h)

(2) Poor condition: More than half of the road is in poor condition causing disruption in services. The road has major cracks, potholes and the road can barely be use. It can still be repaired through some economically efficient rehabilitation. The road may need to be replaced if it is not maintained. (20-40km/h)
(1) Very Poor condition:Road structure has major damage, defects, deformation, deterioration, and or serious impairment in condition. It is not possible to restore the road. (<20km/h)

select.label: Location of Road
select.hint: Classify as urban or rural

select.label: Evacuation road
select.hint: Refers to the evacuation road.

input.label: Number of lanes
input.hint: Record the number of lanes a road has.

input.label: Year Constructed
input.hint: Record the year of the road was constructed.

select.label: Footpath presence
select.hint: Footpath present on the side of the road

input.label: Length
input.hint: Length of road

input.label: Width
input.hint: Width of Road

select.label: Traffic Volume
select.hint: The number of vehicles crossing a section of road per unit time at any selected period.

select.label: Terrain
select.hint: A track of land, especially as considered with reference to its natural features.

input.label: Collect GPS Location
input.hint: Record Geolocation (Long and Lat - Ensure Location is enabled on device).

select.label: Farming tools
